title: How to Write Follow-Up Messages That Close More Jobs
description: Use ChatGPT to write professional follow-ups that turn quotes into paying customers.
requirements: A quote you sent that hasn't gotten a response yet

steps.title: Find a quote that needs follow-up
steps.description: Think of someone you quoted but never heard back from.
substeps: Check your texts, emails, or CRM
Find quotes that are 2-7 days old with no response
steps.tip: The sweet spot is 48-72 hours after sending the quote. Not too pushy, not too late.

steps.title: Ask ChatGPT to write the follow-up
steps.description: Give ChatGPT the context and let it write a natural message.
substeps: Paste this prompt: 'Write a friendly follow-up text for a [your trade] quote I sent 3 days ago. The quote was for [describe the job]. Keep it short and not pushy.'
steps.tip: Ask for 2-3 versions so you can pick the one that sounds most like you.

steps.title: Personalize and send
steps.description: Add a personal touch and send it.
substeps: Add their name if ChatGPT didn't include it
Reference something specific about the job
Send via text (not email — texts get read faster)

steps.title: Create a follow-up sequence
substeps: Day 7: Add value (tip related to their problem)
After that: Move on, but add to your 'cold leads' list

steps.title: Save your best templates
steps.description: Build a library of follow-ups that work.
substeps: When a follow-up message leads to a booking, save it
Create a note on your phone called 'Follow-up Templates'
Paste in messages that got responses
Reuse and adapt them for future quotes

successMessage: You just sent a professional follow-up that could win you a job! Do this for every quote that goes quiet.
proTips: 80% of sales happen after 5+ follow-ups — most contractors give up after 1
A simple 'Hey, just checking if you had any questions about the quote?' works great
Don't apologize for following up. You're providing a service, not being annoying.
